segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even blink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron is probably soaked by now, but she’s still drying that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so close to falling, and the girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the woman—she’s going to have a mess to clean up later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, and she has no clue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and I can’t watch—someone’s going to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is ruining the cabinets, and she’s just standing there, oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just turn off the faucet before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the kids don’t get in trouble, but they probably will.
segments.speaker: PAR
